poem:
"Of Words and Women"

Dew brushed tales - 
Enright, Grenville, Hammad,
women of script, etchings unfolding.
Subtle migration of souls and solace,
Deep in the marrow of pages.

Wren song pierces the still morning,
Brotherless night echoes lament.
A restless dolly roams,
Ghost entering the stage, unseen.
Soldier and sailor bid goodbye,
And my heart, a river in the narrative's flow.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Anne Enright, Kate Grenville and Isabella Hammad shortlisted for Women’s prize for fiction Anne Enright, Kate Grenville and Isabella Hammad are among the contenders for this year’s Women’s prize for fiction, on a shortlist that features migration as a recurring theme. The Wren, The Wren by Anne Enright (Jonathan Cape)  Brotherless Night by VV Ganeshananthan (Viking)  Restless Dolly Maunder by Kate Grenville (Canongate)  Enter Ghost by Isabella Hammad (Jonathan Cape) Soldier Sailor by Claire Kilroy (Faber & Faber) River". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Anne Enright, Kate Grenville and Isabella Hammad shortlisted for Women’s prize for fiction Anne Enright, Kate Grenville and Isabella Hammad are among the contenders for this year’s Women’s prize for fiction, on a shortlist that features migration as a recurring theme. The Wren, The Wren by Anne Enright (Jonathan Cape)  Brotherless Night by VV Ganeshananthan (Viking)  Restless Dolly Maunder by Kate Grenville (Canongate)  Enter Ghost by Isabella Hammad (Jonathan Cape) Soldier Sailor by Claire Kilroy (Faber & Faber) River
